attributes.action: Recognise Pagan handfasting as a legal form of marriage in England and Wales
attributes.additional_details: According to the 2021 census, there were almost 53,000 pagans in the UK. This may not seem a lot, but even a small amount deserves the chance to wed in a ceremony appropriate to their beliefs and religion. England and Wales deserve the chance to wed in a Pagan religious ceremony.
attributes.background: Handfasting has been an ancient form of marriage since before Christianity reached the country. Where it is legal to be handfasted, it is not recognised in England and Wales as a legal form of marriage, such as Christian ceremonies are.

signatures_by_constituency.mp: Rt Hon Sir Greg Knight MP
signatures_by_constituency.name: East Yorkshire
